title: Static in game highlights audio
body:
[check computer volume before playing] 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n2Fg-pfQboY

highlight I took on my desktop

Is there a way to fix this?

replies.body:
As a heads up, this has been impacting me as well. I'll try a few of these fixes in the coming day and report back. I use Razer Synapse and likely have ffwd'd prior to highlight.

Thanks!

Wow......thanks for that heads up about the audio XD. That screeching audio can happen for a few different reasons depending on what exactly is going on, so let's try a couple different quick fixes first. 

If you're using Razr Synapse, let's try disabling that when you make the highlight. I've seen some reports from other players that turning off your Synapse has helped make that screeching stop for some reason.

Next let's try rerecording that highlight, but _**make sure not to use the fast forward feature before you start recording**_. This is another weird thing that I've seen many players confirming that this is what caused the noise to begin with, and not fast forwarding was able to make it stop. 

Hit me back up and let me know if either of those works, I'm actually incredibly curious to get to the bottom of this myself.

Thanks for the response

so the first recording was done without using the 2x style fast forward and it had screeching (made another one just to make sure and it also had  screeching)

I made an another recording without using any timeline traversal tool( so I didn't skip ahead in the game) before starting to record and it minimized screeching there is only a little bit in the beginning before I skip forward (I also made another highlight from a different recording doing the same thing and it also only had screeching prior to the skip none after)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SOz-OK-LDb0&feature=youtu.be

Well it's good we were able to tone down that noise a bit, but I definitely want it gone for GOOD.

Reach out to us in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so that we can take a closer look with you at what exactly is going on. There's a lot more we can do one on one with you there.
